chunk_00001.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — evening, warm interior lighting with stage spotlights

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Phoebe Buffay: purple long-sleeved top - green skirt - long, curly blonde hair - smiling, animated
Rachel Green: denim jacket - dark skirt - dark, shoulder-length hair - arms crossed, expression neutral
Monica Geller: light-colored sweater - dark pants - dark, tied-back hair - smiling, attentive
Chandler Bing: dark leather jacket - red shirt - short, dark hair - smiling, leaning forward
Ross Geller: light-colored shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - expression neutral, listening
Joey Tribbiani: dark jacket - white shirt - short, dark hair - expression neutral, seated

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Phoebe Buffay stands at the microphone, playing an acoustic guitar and singing to an audience. Rachel Green stands nearby, arms crossed, watching Phoebe. Monica Geller sits on a couch, smiling and watching the performance. Chandler Bing leans forward, smiling at Phoebe. Ross Geller sits beside Monica, listening attentively. Joey Tribbiani sits nearby, observing the scene. The group appears engaged and entertained by Phoebe's performance.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Acoustic guitar: light wood finish (being played by Phoebe)
- Microphone: on stand (in front of Phoebe)
- Central Perk sign: visible in background
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on tables)
- Orange couch: center of frame
- Brick wall decor: background

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Phoebe Buffay discusses a song about realizing what life is really all about with the audience. The conversation has a casual, musical tone, with Phoebe appearing animated and enthusiastic, and the listeners reacting by smiling and clapping.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Scene begins with Phoebe performing on stage
Rachel Green stands near the stage, arms crossed
Monica Geller sits on the couch, smiling
Chandler Bing leans forward, smiling
Ross Geller sits beside Monica, listening
Joey Tribbiani sits nearby, observing
Audience claps after Phoebe finishes singing
chunk_00001.subtitles: Everybody. Shh. Uh, Central Perk is proud to present... ...the music of Miss Phoebe Buffay. PHOEBE: Thanks. Hi. Um, I wanna start with a song that's about that moment... ...when you suddenly realize what life is really all about. Okay, here we go. Okay. Thank you very much. CHANDLER: What...? Oh, great. This is just...

chunk_00002.caption:
**SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, dim lighting with candles and lamps
The room is furnished with an orange couch, a wooden coffee table, and a brick wall with decor. The scene transitions to an outdoor fountain at night, then to a dark city skyline.

**CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored top - dark pants - long, wavy brown hair - smiling
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated
Phoebe Buffay: dark top - dark pants - dark, curly hair - smiling
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt - dark pants - short, brown hair - smiling
Joey Tribbiani: dark shirt - dark pants - short, brown hair - smiling
Ross Geller: dark shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - serious
David Schwimmer: dark shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - serious

**ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
The group is gathered in Monica’s apartment, reacting with excitement to a city-wide blackout. Rachel stands holding a tray, smiling. Monica gestures animatedly while talking on the phone. Phoebe lies on the floor, sipping from a straw. Chandler and Joey sit on the couch, smiling and talking. Ross stands near the doorway, looking concerned. David Schwimmer stands near the couch, looking serious. The group moves to the outdoor fountain, then to a dark city skyline.

**OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden coffee table (center)
- Brick wall decor (background)
- Candles (on table)
- Fountain (outdoor)
- City skyline (background)

**DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses the blackout with the group. The conversation has a casual tone, with Rachel appearing excited and Monica reacting by gesturing animatedly. The group is reacting to the blackout, with some members appearing concerned and others smiling.

**TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Scene begins with all characters seated
Rachel stands up and holds a tray
Monica gestures animatedly while talking on the phone
Phoebe lies on the floor, sipping from a straw
Chandler and Joey sit on the couch, smiling and talking
Ross stands near the doorway, looking concerned
David Schwimmer stands near the couch, looking serious
The group moves to the outdoor fountain
The scene transitions to a dark city skyline
chunk_00002.subtitles: This is so cool, you guys. The entire city's blacked out. Mom says it's Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens... ...and doesn't know when it'll be back on. PHOEBE: Wow. RACHEL: You guys, this is big. Pants and a sweater. Why, Mom? Who will I meet in a blackout? Power-company guys? Eligible looters?

chunk_00003.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment kitchen — nighttime, dim lighting with candles and warm lamps

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: light-colored sweater - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - concerned expression
Rachel Green: dark-colored top - dark pants - long, wavy brown hair - smiling expression
Ross Geller: light-colored turtleneck sweater - dark pants - short, dark hair - serious expression
Phoebe Buffay: red long-sleeved top - dark pants - blonde, shoulder-length hair - serious expression
Chandler Bing: dark jacket over light shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - serious expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica and Rachel are in the kitchen, talking and gesturing while holding candles. Ross is seen in the background, also holding a candle. Phoebe is in a bank vestibule, talking on her phone while leaning against a counter. Chandler is standing in the bank vestibule, looking at Phoebe with a serious expression.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Candles: multiple, lit (on counter and table)
- Phone: black, being held by Phoebe
- ATM machines: two, visible in bank vestibule
- Counter: light-colored, with a black bag on it
- Posters: visible on wall behind Phoebe, including one that says "Save a Person's Life"

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Phoebe discusses being trapped in a bank vestibule with Chandler Bing, who is also present. The conversation has a tense tone, with Phoebe appearing serious and Chandler looking concerned. Phoebe mentions being with "some guy," while Chandler reacts with a serious expression.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Phoebe moves from standing to leaning against the counter while talking on the phone.
Chandler shifts his position slightly while looking at Phoebe.
chunk_00003.subtitles: Power-company guys? Eligible looters? Can we talk about this later? Okay. Can I borrow the phone? I wanna call my apartment and check on my grandma. What's my number? I never call me. CHANDLER [THINKING]: Oh, my God. It's her. It's that Victoria Secret model. Something Goodacre. Hi, Mom, it's Jill. She's right. It's Jill. Jill Goodacre. Oh, my God. I am trapped in an ATM vestibule with Jill Goodacre. Is it a vestibule? Maybe it's an atrium? Yeah, that is the part to focus on, you idiot. Yeah, I'm fine. I'm just stuck at the bank in an ATM vestibule. Jill says vestibule... ...I'm going with vestibule. JILL: I'm fine. No, I'm not alone. I don't know. Some guy. Oh, some guy. I am some guy.

chunk_00004.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
A dimly lit bank lobby during nighttime, with artificial lighting. The scene transitions to a dark apartment interior, also lit by candles, suggesting a blackout.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Chandler Bing: dark-colored coat - light-colored pants - dark, short hair - smiling expression
Rachel Green: red top - dark pants - long, brown hair - concerned expression
Joey Tribbiani: red t-shirt - jeans - dark, short hair - animated expression
Ross Geller: light-colored sweater - dark pants - brown, short hair - serious expression
Monica Geller: dark-colored top - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - concerned expression
Phoebe Buffay: purple top - patterned dress - long, blonde hair - animated expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Chandler enters a bank, smiling, and interacts with a woman in a red top. The scene shifts to an apartment where Joey, holding a lit menorah, enters and gestures dramatically. Ross and Monica stand nearby, looking on. Phoebe and Rachel react with concern and amusement. Joey continues to gesture while holding the menorah, and Ross bends down to adjust something near a guitar. The group gathers around a window, looking out with expressions of surprise and concern.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Menorah: lit candles (held by Joey)
- Guitar: on a chair (near Ross)
- Candles: multiple lit candles (on tables and in the room)
- Bank teller machine: visible in the bank lobby
- Bank posters: visible on the wall
- Window: with a grid pattern, showing the group looking out

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Joey discusses officiating a Hanukkah ceremony during a blackout with the group. The conversation has a joking tone, with Joey appearing animated and the others reacting with concern and amusement. The group seems to be reacting to the situation with a mix of humor and surprise.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Chandler enters the bank lobby
Joey enters the apartment holding a menorah
Ross bends down near the guitar
The group gathers around the window
chunk_00004.subtitles: Oh, some guy. I am some guy. Hey, Jill, I saw you with some guy last night. Yes, he was some guy. JOEY: Hey, everyone. Officiating at tonight's blackout is Rabbi Tribbiani. Chandler's old roommate was Jewish, and these are the only candles we have... ...so happy Hanukkah. PHOEBE: Ooh, look. Ugly Naked Guy lit a bunch of candles. ALL: Ooh. Oh! Ooh. That had to hurt. CHANDLER [THINKING]: All right, all right. It's been 14 and a half minutes... ...and you still haven't said one word. Oh, God.

chunk_00005.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Emerson Bank ATM vestibule — nighttime, dim artificial lighting

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Chandler Bing: dark-colored coat - light-colored shirt - brown, medium-length hair - expression shifts from concerned to amused
Unidentified person: red long-sleeved top - dark pants - blonde, shoulder-length hair - expression shifts from neutral to annoyed

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Chandler Bing stands near an ATM, initially looking concerned while talking on the phone, then smiles as he interacts with the woman at the counter. The woman, standing behind the counter, appears annoyed and gestures with her hands while speaking. Chandler eventually walks away from the counter, still on the phone, while the woman watches him leave.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- ATM machine (left side of frame)
- Counter with papers and brochures (right side)
- Phone (held by Chandler)
- Black purse (on counter, next to woman)
- "DAY & NIGHT TELLER" sign (above ATM)
- "Emerson Bank" sign (on display case)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Chandler Bing discusses being stuck in an ATM vestibule with a woman named Jill Goodacre with someone on the phone. The conversation has a humorous, slightly exasperated tone, with Chandler appearing amused and the listener (off-screen) reacting with disbelief or concern.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Chandler Bing walks away from the counter after ending his phone call.
The woman at the counter turns and watches Chandler leave.
chunk_00005.subtitles: ...and you still haven't said one word. Oh, God. Do something. Just make contact. Smile. There you go. You're definitely scaring her. Uh, would you like to call somebody? Yeah, about 300 guys I went to high school with. Yeah, thanks. [PHONE RINGS] Hello? - It's me. - It's Chandler. Are you okay? Yeah, I'm fine. [MUMBLING] I'm stuck in an ATM vestibule... ...with Jill Goodacre. What? [MUMBLING] I'm stuck... ...in an ATM vestibule... ...with Jill Goodacre. I have no idea what you said.

### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, dim lighting with candles providing the primary illumination.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression shifts from concerned to relaxed

Chandler Bing: dark-colored jacket over light shirt - dark pants - dark, short hair - serious, concerned

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Joey stands in the kitchen area, animatedly talking on a landline phone while gesturing with his free hand. Monica sits in a chair, listening intently with a concerned expression. Ross and Rachel sit on the couch, smiling and laughing as they listen to Joey’s story. Chandler stands in a bank vestibule, talking on a phone with a serious expression. The group is gathered in the living room, lit by numerous candles, reacting to Joey’s phone call about being trapped with Jill Goodacre.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Chandler moves from standing in the bank vestibule to standing near a counter with a woman.
Joey moves from standing in the kitchen to sitting on the couch.
Monica moves from sitting in a chair to standing and interacting with Joey.
Ross and Rachel remain seated on the couch throughout the clip.
chunk_00006.subtitles: I have no idea what you said. [IN NORMAL VOICE] Put Joey on the phone. What's up, man? [MUMBLING] I'm stuck... ...in an ATM vestibule... ...with Jill Goodacre. Oh, my God. He's trapped in an ATM vestibule with Jill Goodacre. Chandler, listen. [MUMBLES INDISTINCTLY] [IN NORMAL VOICE] Yeah, like that thought never entered my mind. RACHEL: Come on, somebody. MONICA: I'll go. I'll go. Okay, um, senior year of college, on a pool table. JOEY: Ooh. - Pool table? That's my sister. Okay, okay. My weirdest place would have to be... ...the women's room on the second floor of the New York City Public Library. Oh, my God. What were you doing in a library?

chunk_00007.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, dim lighting with candles and lamps

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**

Monica Geller: dark-colored jacket - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated, expressive
Ross Geller: light-colored sweater - dark pants - dark, short hair - serious, gesturing

Phoebe Buffay: dark top - dark pants - blonde, shoulder-length hair - smiling, listening

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
The group shares stories about their weirdest experiences, with Ross recounting a Disneyland incident and Monica sharing a story about a relationship. The conversation has a casual, humorous tone, with everyone smiling and reacting to each other’s tales.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Scene begins with Joey and Monica seated on the couch. Ross and Rachel sit across from them. Phoebe joins the group, sitting nearby. The group remains seated throughout the clip, with minor shifts in posture and gestures.
chunk_00007.subtitles: - Pheebs, what about you? - Oh, um, Milwaukee. Uh, Ross? [CLEARS THROAT] Disneyland, 1989. "It's a small world after all." No way. The, uh, ride broke down... ...so Carol and I went behind a couple of those mechanical Dutch children. They fixed the ride, and we were asked never to return to the Magic Kingdom. Ooh. Rachel? I already went. - You did not go. - Yes, I did. MONICA: Tell us. Come on. All right, uh, the weirdest place would have to be... ...the foot of the bed. - Step back. - We have a winner. I've never had a relationship with that kind of passion.

chunk_00008.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
The apartment living room — evening, dim lighting with candles providing warm illumination.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: dark-colored denim jacket - unclear lower clothing - dark, shoulder-length hair styled up - expression shifts between serious and animated
Ross Geller: light-colored turtleneck sweater - unclear lower clothing - dark, short hair - expression shifts between concerned and earnest

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel Green sits on the floor, gesturing with her hands as she speaks to Ross Geller, who is seated on the couch holding a blue glass. Ross listens intently, occasionally responding with his own gestures and facial expressions, appearing engaged in the conversation. The scene is intimate, with both characters focused on their dialogue.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Blue glass: held by Ross Geller (on couch)
- Candles: multiple lit candles on tables and in the room
- Couch: patterned cushions visible behind Ross
- Speaker: large wooden speaker with red cone visible behind Rachel
- Pillow: floral patterned pillow on the couch behind Rachel

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses his past relationship with a lack of passion and his ex-wife's lesbianism with Rachel Green. The conversation has a serious tone, with Ross appearing earnest and Rachel reacting with concern and animated gestures.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
None observed.
chunk_00008.subtitles: I've never had a relationship with that kind of passion. Where you have to have somebody right there in the middle of a theme park. It was the only thing to do there that didn't have a line. Well, Barry wouldn't even kiss me on a miniature-golf course. - Come on. - No. He said we were holding up the people behind us. And you didn't marry him because? Do you think there are people that go through life... ...never having that kind of? - Probably. - Really? I'll tell you something. Passion is way overrated. - Yeah, right. - It is. Eventually, it kind of burns out. But hopefully what you're left with is trust and security and, uh... In my ex-wife's case, lesbianism. For all those people who miss out on that, uh, passion thing...

chunk_00009.subtitles: For all those people who miss out on that, uh, passion thing... ...there's other good stuff. Okay. But, um, I don't think that'll be you. - You don't? - Mm-mm. See, I see, uh... ...big passion in your future. - Really? - Mm-hm. - You do? - I do. Ross, you're so great. ROSS: Ah. It's never gonna happen. - What? - You and Rachel. [CHUCKLES] [STUTTERS] Why not? Because you waited too long to make your move... ...and now you're in the "Friend Zone."

chunk_00010.subtitles: ...and now you're in the "Friend Zone." No, no, no. I'm not in the Zone. No, Ross. You're mayor of the Zone. Look, I'm taking my time, all right? I'm laying the groundwork. Every day I get a little bit closer to, uh... Priesthood. Ross, I'm telling you, she has no idea what you're thinking. If you don't ask her out soon, you'll end up stuck in the Zone forever. I will, I will. I'm waiting for the, uh, right moment. What? - What, now? - Yeah. What's messing you up? The wine? The candles? The moonlight? Huh? You gotta go up to her and say, "Look, Rachel, I think..." - Shh! - Shh! - What are we shushing? - We're shushing... ...because we're trying to hear something. - What? - Uh, don't you hear that?

Monica’s apartment living room — evening, dim lighting with candles and lamps
The room is decorated with candles, plants, and furniture, suggesting a cozy, intimate setting during a power outage.

Rachel Green: dark-colored jacket - dark pants - brown, shoulder-length hair - expression: serious, focused
Chandler Bing: dark-colored jacket - light shirt - brown, short hair - expression: thoughtful, then smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross and Chandler stand near Rachel, who is holding a wine glass. Ross gestures animatedly while speaking, and Chandler listens, then smiles slightly. Rachel appears focused, possibly listening intently. Later, Chandler walks toward an ATM while Ross watches him. Phoebe is seen sitting on a couch playing a guitar, singing softly, while Rachel enters the room and approaches her. Ross and Chandler are seen in the kitchen area, with Ross holding a wine glass and Chandler standing nearby.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**

- Wooden table: with various items (background)
- ATM machine: silver (in bank scene)
- Backpack: black (on ATM)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross and Chandler discuss something with Rachel, possibly related to the power outage. The conversation has a casual tone, with Ross appearing animated and Chandler listening thoughtfully. Rachel reacts by looking at them and then moving toward Phoebe, who is singing. The dialogue includes a mention of gum and a joke about taking it, suggesting a lighthearted moment.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
- Chandler walks toward the ATM
- Phoebe enters the frame from the right side
- Rachel moves from the kitchen area to the couch
- Ross and Chandler shift positions in the kitchen area
chunk_00011.subtitles: - What? - Uh, don't you hear that? Ah. - See? - Huh. - Would you like some gum? - Oh. Is it sugarless? - Uh, sorry, it's not. - Then, no, thanks. CHANDLER [THINKING]: What the hell was that? Mental note: If Jill Goodacre offers you gum, you take it. If she offers you mangled animal carcass, you take it. PHOEBE [SINGING]: New York City has no power And the milk is getting sour But to me it is not scary 'Cause I stay away from dairy La-la La-la-la-la-la - Here goes. - You'll do it? - I'll do it. - Want help?

chunk_00012.subtitles: - I'll do it. - Want help? You come out there, you're a dead man. Ross, Ross. Good luck, man. Thanks. - Okay. - Okay. JOEY: Where you going? MONICA: Outside. You can't go out there. - Why not? - Because of, uh, the reason. And that would be? I, uh... I can't tell you. What's going on? Okay, listen. You gotta promise you'll never, ever tell Ross that I told you. - About what? - He's planning your birthday party. Oh, my God. I love him. You better act surprised. - About what? - My surprise party. - What surprise party? - Oh, stop it. Joey already told me. Well, he didn't tell me. Don't look at me. This is Ross' thing. This is so typical. I'm always the last to know everything.
